content.description: Start with right foot low and left foot high on the side-pull to the left of the start of the crack. Traverse to the right up the crack. Top out using crimps to the left.
content.location: At the beginning of the cave trail, on the right side, well before the cave.

content.description: Standing start on the lowest footholds. Easy first couple of moves on solid hands and feet. The crux occurs two-thirds of the way up where your only handhold is a right-hand two finger razor crimp, there are no ledges for the feet and you have to make a fairly big move to the top.

Sit start below the big flake on the right of the main slab face with left hand on the bottom-left of the flake and right hand on a hidden side pull. Climb straight up the flake keeping your right hand along the edge. Top out to the right of the tree.

 All of the slab to the right of the crack is off
Start low on the big side face, traverse left with pinches and crimps, step over the crack and slab, go up with the use of side-pulls, top out on crimps. not many footholds, smearing advised.
content.location: Just past and to the left of the cave to the right of the trail if going north. To the right of the tree at the base of Mozzie V2.

content.description: Crimpy climb on the right hand of the shield
content.location: South facing wall on the far right side of the cave massif

content.description: Juggy but long boulder on the left edge of the south facing shield far right from the cave
content.location: Walk south (right when facing the cave), very soon you'll see the south facing wall  on your left. Its the last bit of rock connected to the cave massif.

content.description: Straight up the shield. Fun long boulder, slopey top out
content.location: south facing wall on the right of the cave massif

content.description: Start up on a low lip ledge, climbing up and to the right. Sparse footholds. Top out by climbing over. depending on season or conditions, you may need to brush away leaves and needles.
content.location: Just past and to the left of the cave to the right of the trail if traveling north. There is a tree at the base of the climb.

content.description: Start on a right crimp and very low left sidepull jug. Use compression moves to reach the top of the boulder, then top out slightly to the left.
content.location: on the left side of the cave

content.description: Obvious line with a sit start just right of the cave opening. Three big moves and then a full body mantle, from there 12ft of V0 pine needle scraping to the top
content.protection: 1 pad, don't fall after the mantle
content.location: On the little balcony that holds the cave itself

content.description: Sit start with your fingers in the obvious 'letterbox' and you feet smearing, bump right hand to the 'dream crimp', launch for the slopey jug. From here its a powerful traverse left into 'Cave Away'
content.location: ~14ft right of the cave opening, likely you see the 'letterbox' all chalked up.

content.description: Same start for hands as Splat. Move up the flake using the left side and the face (no right edge of the flake). Top out to the left of the tree.

Bad foot smear to start with right hand on crimp and left hand on the diagonal crimp line. Right hand up to razor crimp high left foot followed by a right foot on the starting right hand hold. Reach up to the final top out crimps.
content.location: Close to the start of the cave trail, on the right side of the path. To the left of Straight and Narrow.

content.description: Start with the left hand in the seem as an undercrimp. Right hand gaston, stand up proud and slap the right hand to the diagonal crimp. Move your feet up on tiny nothing holds, and reach for the finishing crimps slightly on the left. A smidge easier than Bagel Fox, but nice and sharp nonetheless
content.location: Just left of Bagel Fox, near the start of the cave trail

content.description: Start on the lowest part of the slab and work your way up the arete, keeping your feet on the main face and hands on or to the right of the arete.
content.location: Far left of the cave slabs

content.description: Just beyond the parking lot on the Greenwich side is a small cliff band with slabs and a small cave.
